revised_title: Asymmetry Currents in Squid Giant Axons: Effects of Holding Potential
tldr: This study investigates the asymmetry currents in intracellularly perfused squid giant axons and how holding potential affects these currents. The authors found that the effect of holding potential develops slowly and that the position of the distribution curve depends on the holding potential. These findings support the idea that the asymmetry current is not inactivated at low holding potentials.
